p: When tested against CCh and high K +-mediated spasm in rat ileum preparations, EC-I and EC-G caused dose-dependent (0.01–5 mg/mL) complete inhibition. In CCh-mediated contractions, EC-I exhibited inhibition with resultant EC 50 values of 0.76 mg/mL [0.54–0.92, 95% confidence interval (CI), n = 4], whereas EC-G exhibited inhibition with higher EC 50 value of 4.22 mg/mL (3.86–4.12, 95% CI, n = 4) ( Figure 3A). EC-I and EC-G exhibited inhibition against high K +-mediated contractions with EC 50 values of 0.08 mg/mL (0.06–0.09, 95% CI, n = 4) and 0.24 mg/mL (0.18–0.28, 95% CI, n = 4), respectively ( Figure 3B).
